conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m formally applying to School_C as my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit immediately if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I have relatively low priority there (4th), while Student_B and Student_A are likely to apply and outrank me. In contrast, at School_E I am ranked 1st, guaranteeing acceptance if I apply now. Since a match locks in and removes both sides, applying to School_E immediately secures a sure match, though it is my last choice. I will first try for a higher true preference. Between School_C and School_A, School_A ranks me last (5th) so it is even worse. School_D ranks me 4th and may be contested by Student_C (2nd there) and Student_A (1st there). Therefore, my best shot at a top outcome is to apply to School_C right away and hope higher-priority students commit elsewhere. If rejected, I can pivot quickly in later rounds, with School_E as a safe fallback where I am top priority.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your strong interest in School_C and for applying. At this time, we’re not able to offer you admission. We appreciate your application and wish you the very best with your other options.
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on School_C’s true priority list (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). Although Student_E lists School_C as #1 and is applying now, it is early (round 1) and higher-priority students are likely to apply to School_C soon: Student_B has School_C as #2, Student_C has School_C as #2, and School_C’s top choice Student_B may apply after School_E. With quota 1, accepting Student_E now risks blocking a higher-priority match. Prefer to reject now and keep capacity for higher-ranked candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_C and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m especially excited about joining a community with strong academics and a supportive environment, and I would be eager to contribute actively on campus. I would like to formally apply and be considered for your available seat.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have strong priority there (2nd after Student_A), so applying immediately maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before other students commit elsewhere. Even if Student_A applies, I still have a credible shot if they go for their higher-ranked options (School_E or School_B).

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for ranking School_D as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to have you join our community. Congratulations—welcome to School_D!
conversation.thought: Student_C is 2nd on School_D’s true priority list (only behind Student_A) and explicitly ranks School_D as their 1st choice, making acceptance highly likely to be stable. In this round, the only applicant to School_D is Student_C, and holding out for Student_A is risky because Student_A’s top choices are School_E then School_B, with School_D only 3rd; School_E and School_B may accept them, meaning Student_A may never reach us. With quota 1, accepting Student_C now secures a very high-priority match rather than gambling for the top-ranked student who may not apply.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m formally applying for your open seat. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would accept immediately if offered. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice, School_E, immediately. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), and early application can secure the only seat before competition resolves. Since School_E is my highest true preference, it is worth a direct, committed application rather than exploratory talk.

conversation.message:

We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

In this round, both Student_B and Student_D also applied to School_E, and Student_B is higher priority than Student_A and is likely to accept (School_E is Student_B’s first choice). With quota 1, accepting Student_A now would block a better-priority match available immediately. Therefore reject Student_A to preserve the seat for Student_B.

conversation.message: School_E is my clear first choice. I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join and would accept immediately if offered a place. I believe I can contribute positively to the school community and take full advantage of the academic opportunities at School_E. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. Although School_E ranks me 4th and may prefer Student_E/B/A, the best strategy to maximize my outcome is to apply to my first choice immediately rather than waste a round talking, since capacity is only 1 and competition will be intense. I will signal strong commitment and fit to increase my chances if higher-priority students do not apply or are matched elsewhere.

Therefore reject Student_D to preserve capacity for Student_B. Student_D can likely match elsewhere (they rank School_A/B ahead of School_D/C after E).

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I’m strongly committed to enrolling if accepted. To maximize our outcome within quota, we should accept the highest-ranked applicant available now: Student_B. Rejecting to wait for Student_E is too risky given their low interest in School_E, and accepting B also blocks lower-priority A/D.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions,

Sincerely,
Student_D

With limited rounds and capacity 1, I should apply now rather than just talk to avoid losing the spot to another applicant.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_E and I would like to formally apply to School_A. conversation.thought: School_C (my top choice) already rejected me, so I should move to my next highest true preference that is still available. School_A is my #2 choice and is currently unmatched, so I will submit a formal application emphasizing fit and willingness to enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:

We wish you the very best in the rest of the matching process and in your high school journey.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (remaining quota 0) with Student_D, who is also very high on our true priority list (2nd). Per rules, when quota is 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Therefore, we must reject Student_E despite being on our priority list.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A. School_B is my top remaining choice, and I’m formally applying for your open seat. I’m very excited about the chance to join School_B and would accept immediately if offered. Thank you for your consideration.

conversation.message:
